assertions_made.justification: OMIM states CAV3 mutations cause several skeletal muscle phenotypes with overlap and a clinical continuum, and also lists distinct cardiac phenotypes (hypertrophic cardiomyopathy and LQT9). Orphanet separately lists rippling muscle disease, distal myopathy, hyperCKemia, and Romano-Ward syndrome for CAV3.

molecular_mechanism.justification: Skeletal muscle caveolinopathies commonly show reduced/absent caveolin-3 and dominant-negative behavior, with many mutations leading to loss/mislocalization of CAV3. LQT9 variants show gain-of-function at the level of cardiac sodium current (2–5× increased late INa), indicating a mechanistically distinct channelopathy.

phenotypic_variability.justification: OMIM notes many patients show overlap of skeletal muscle entities, lack of genotype/phenotype correlation, and intrafamilial variability spanning rippling, distal myopathy, and isolated hyperCKemia. This supports a spectrum within skeletal presentations.

mode_of_inheritance.justification: Most skeletal phenotypes are autosomal dominant with rare autosomal recessive RMD2 families; LQT9 is autosomal dominant; cardiomyopathy is autosomal dominant. Differences in inheritance (presence of AR only in skeletal group) align with phenotype groupings and management distinctions.

proposed_groupings.reasoning: OMIM describes skeletal caveolinopathies as a clinical continuum with overlapping presentations and shared loss/mislocalization of CAV3; the same variants can cause rippling, distal myopathy, or isolated hyperCKemia.
Cardiac channelopathy with gain-of-function effect on late sodium current is mechanistically and clinically distinct from skeletal caveolinopathies.
Listed by OMIM as a separate phenotype with families lacking skeletal muscle signs; clinical management and organ system differ from both skeletal spectrum and LQT9.

overall_decision.summary_reasoning: CAV3 causes a spectrum of skeletal muscle caveolinopathies that should be lumped due to explicit assertions of a clinical continuum, shared pathogenic mechanisms (loss/mislocalization, dominant-negative), and marked intra-/intrafamilial variability. In contrast, LQT9 represents a distinct cardiac channelopathy with gain-of-function effects and different clinical management, and hypertrophic cardiomyopathy appears as a separate cardiac structural phenotype with families lacking skeletal involvement; both should be split from the skeletal spectrum.

top_supporting_evidence: OMIM: "Mutations in the CAV3 gene can cause different skeletal muscle phenotypes... Many patients show an overlap... some authors have suggested that the caveolinopathies constitute a clinical continuum... there are no genotype/phenotype correlations... intrafamilial variability."

OMIM (LQT9): "Electrophysiologic analysis... demonstrated that the mutant caveolin-3 resulted in a 2- to 3-fold increase in the late sodium current..." and SIDS-linked variants showed a 5-fold increase.
OMIM (HCM): "In 2 brothers with hypertrophic cardiomyopathy... Both of them as well as their father had no symptoms of skeletal muscle disorder and no elevation of serum creatine kinase."
suggested_action_for_curator: Confirm whether any additional recent sources further clarify the mechanism and strength of association for hypertrophic cardiomyopathy due to CAV3.
Document the presence of rare autosomal recessive RMD2 cases within the skeletal spectrum and note implications for counseling.
